alert.note: Alert for Chilton; Coosa; Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 26 at 8:11PM CDT until March 27 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: .Heavy rainfall will continue to move over the area through the evening. Automated gauges are showing elevated flows in area streams and these will react quickly to the current and expected rainfall. An upgrade to a flash flood warning may become necessary if the rainfall persists or continues to intensify. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Chilton, Coosa and Tallapoosa. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Creeks and small streams are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 808 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Alexander City, Calera, Clanton, Jemison, Goodwater, Rockford, Kellyton, Weogufka, Stewartville, Thorsby, Jacksons` Gap, New Site, Maplesville, Goldville, Moriah, Lyle, Unity, Dollar, Bentleyville and Higgins Ferry Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
